Exports a QFeatures object to a Excel file.

Source: R/export_qfeatures.R
QFeatures-excel.Rd

This function exports an instance of the class QFeatures to a Excel file. The resulting file is composed of four sheets:

  • quantitative data which contains the content of assay() object whith a color code for each cell w.r.t. to cell quantitative metadata.

  • metadata which is the content of rowData() with only one-dimensionnal data (i.e. the adjacencyMatrix and the qMetadata slots are not part of the sheet),

  • exp. design which is the content of colData(). Each condition in the table is colored with a different color,

  • quantitative metadata which is the content of qMetadata(). There is a color code for the different tags.

# S4 method for QFeatures
write2excel(object, i = NULL, filename = "newFile", ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
write2excel(object, filename, exp.design, ...)

Arguments

filename

A character string for the name of the Excel file.

obj

An object of class QFeatures.

Value

A Excel file.

Author

Samuel Wieczorek

Examples

# \donttest{
data(ft)
#> Warning: data set 'ft' not found

#---------------------------------------
# Export the whole dataset
#---------------------------------------

write2excel(ft, filename = 'foo')
#> Error in write2excel(ft, filename = "foo"): could not find function "write2excel"
write2excel(ft, 1, 'foo')
#> Error in write2excel(ft, 1, "foo"): could not find function "write2excel"
# }
